item.description:
Sorry for the short notice, but hope you can join us for dim sum on Sunday @ China Pearl in Chinatown.

The August Moon Festival will also be going on in Chinatown that day. There will be cultural performances, martial arts, food vendors, etc. and we will walk around after dim sum.

According to legend, in 1368 the Chinese overthrew the Mongol Yuan dynasty with the help of messages hidden in moon cakes. These tasty disc-shaped flaky pastries, filled with sweetened bean-paste and marked on top with the symbol of the baker, have thus become the food most associated with the August Moon, or Mid-Autumn festival.

Boston's Chinatown is the third largest Chinese neighborhood in the country so festivities are usually a busy, lively affair with plenty to see and do.

I will provide my cell # to those that rsvp yes. I will be there early to put in for reservations.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll have meetup name tag on

group.name: The Greater Boston Asian Professionals Meetup Group

item.name: Dim Sum & August Moon Festival
